unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Film Fest Frenzy
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Your Guide to the Film Fest Frenzy

unnormalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema lovers! Ever feel like you need a break from the usual masala movies and want something… different? Then it's time you dived into the world of film festivals! Think of them as a mela, but instead of jalebis, you get cutting-edge cinema and thought-provoking documentaries.
normalised: Hey Bollywood buffs and cinema lovers! Ever feel like you need a break from the usual masala movies and want something… different? Then it's time you dived into the world of film festivals! Think of them as a mela, but instead of jalebis, you get cutting-edge cinema and thought-provoking documentaries.

unnormalised: Film festivals are like a treasure trove, showcasing everything from independent films to international cinema that you wouldn't normally find at your local PVR. Imagine stumbling upon the next Anurag Kashyap before everyone else knows his name!
normalised: Film festivals are like a treasure trove, showcasing everything from independent films to international cinema that you wouldn't normally find at your local P V R. Imagine stumbling upon the next Anurag Kashyap before everyone else knows his name!

unnormalised: India has a bunch of cool film festivals. We have the International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa, which is HUGE, and the Mumbai Film Festival (MAMI), usually held in October, that showcases some serious talent. Then there are smaller, niche festivals focusing on documentaries, short films, and regional cinema. Check out the Kolkata International Film Festival, if you are into Bengali films.

Then there are smaller, niche festivals focusing on documentaries, short films, and regional cinema. Check out the Kolkata International Film Festival, if you are into Bengali films.

unnormalised: Why should you go? First, you get to see films that challenge your perspective. Second, you meet filmmakers, actors, and fellow movie geeks! Networking, baby! Third, you might discover your next favourite director. Trust me, it's way more exciting than binge-watching the same old stuff on Netflix.

unnormalised: Think of it like this: Instead of just knowing about the big blockbusters like "Pathaan," you'll be able to impress your friends with your knowledge of Iranian cinema or indie films from Kerala.

unnormalised: Plus, let's be real, attending a film festival is a total vibe. You're surrounded by creative energy, engaging in discussions, and feeling like you're part of something bigger. Its a good break from the daily grind. Think Rs. 500 for a single movie. You might even run into a famous face or two! Maybe even get a selfie with Karan Johar (okay, maybe).
